Apple___Apple_Scab.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Venturia inaequalis.
Apple___Apple_Scab.Symptoms: Dark, irregularly-shaped lesions on leaves, blossoms, and fruits; premature leaf and fruit drop may occur.
Apple___Apple_Scab.Prevention: Sanitize fallen leaves, ensure proper spacing and airflow, plant resistant varieties.
Apple___Apple_Scab.Treatment: Apply fungicides such as Captan or EBDCs at 2-week intervals during early growth.

Apple___Black_Rot.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Diplodia seriata.
Apple___Black_Rot.Symptoms: Dark lesions on leaves, branches, and fruits; fruit may shrivel and leaves may wilt.
Apple___Black_Rot.Prevention: Remove infected plant parts, maintain orchard sanitation, plant resistant varieties.
Apple___Black_Rot.Treatment: Use protectant fungicides like Mancozeb or Ziram before infection occurs.

Apple___Cedar_Apple_Rust.Cause: Fungal infection requiring both apple and cedar hosts (Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae).
Apple___Cedar_Apple_Rust.Symptoms: Yellow-orange spots on leaves and fruits; can cause fruit deformation.
Apple___Cedar_Apple_Rust.Prevention: Remove nearby cedar trees, ensure proper airflow, plant resistant apple varieties.
Apple___Cedar_Apple_Rust.Treatment: Fungicides containing Myclobutanil applied before infection spreads.

Apple___Healthy.Symptoms: Green, healthy leaves and fruits without lesions or discoloration.
Apple___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and orchard sanitation.

Bell Pepper___Bacterial_Spot.Cause: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas euvesicatoria.
Bell Pepper___Bacterial_Spot.Symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits; leaves may yellow and drop.
Bell Pepper___Bacterial_Spot.Prevention: Use certified disease-free seeds, avoid overhead irrigation, rotate crops.
Bell Pepper___Bacterial_Spot.Treatment: Copper-based bactericides; remove infected plant parts.

Bell Pepper___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy green leaves and fruits; no spots or discoloration.
Bell Pepper___Healthy.Prevention: Provide balanced nutrients, water, and good field management.

Cherry___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves, stems, and fruits; uniform color and no lesions.
Cherry___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper irrigation, nutrition, and pruning.

Cherry___Powdery_Mildew.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Podosphaera clandestina.
Cherry___Powdery_Mildew.Symptoms: White powdery growth on leaves, shoots, and fruits; may cause leaf curling and stunted growth.
Cherry___Powdery_Mildew.Prevention: Plant resistant cultivars, ensure proper pruning and airflow, avoid excessive nitrogen.
Cherry___Powdery_Mildew.Treatment: Use horticultural oils or fungicides designed for powdery mildew control.

Corn (Maize)___Cercospora_Leaf_Spot.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Cercospora spp.
Corn (Maize)___Cercospora_Leaf_Spot.Symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves, may merge into larger necrotic areas; leaves may yellow and drop.
Corn (Maize)___Cercospora_Leaf_Spot.Prevention: Avoid overhead watering, ensure spacing for airflow, remove infected leaves.
Corn (Maize)___Cercospora_Leaf_Spot.Treatment: Apply fungicides and maintain proper irrigation practices to reduce leaf wetness.

Corn (Maize)___Common_Rust_.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Puccinia sorghi.
Corn (Maize)___Common_Rust_.Symptoms: Small reddish-brown pustules on leaves; may reduce photosynthesis in severe cases.
Corn (Maize)___Common_Rust_.Prevention: Plant resistant varieties, remove volunteer corn plants, rotate crops.
Corn (Maize)___Common_Rust_.Treatment: Fungicide application if infection is severe and conditions are favorable.

Corn (Maize)___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy green leaves with no spots or discoloration.
Corn (Maize)___Healthy.Prevention: Provide balanced nutrients, irrigation, and good field management.

Corn (Maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Exserohilum turcicum.
Corn (Maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.Symptoms: Large, cigar-shaped gray-green lesions on leaves; leaves may die prematurely.
Corn (Maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.Prevention: Resistant varieties, crop rotation, remove crop residues.

Grape___Black_Rot.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Guignardia bidwellii.
Grape___Black_Rot.Symptoms: Dark, circular lesions on leaves and fruits; infected berries shrivel.
Grape___Black_Rot.Prevention: Prune for airflow, remove mummified berries, plant resistant varieties.
Grape___Black_Rot.Treatment: Apply fungicides such as Captan during susceptible growth stages.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Cause: Fungal infection caused by Phaeomoniella chlamydospora and Phaeoacremonium spp.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Symptoms: Dark streaks in wood, black spots on berries, leaf yellowing, vine decline over years.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Prevention: Use healthy planting material, avoid pruning wounds, remove infected wood.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Treatment: No chemical cure; remove affected parts and manage vineyard sanitation.

Grape___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves, stems, and fruits with no discoloration.
Grape___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper irrigation, pruning, and nutrition.

Grape___Leaf_Blight.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Isariopsis vitis.
Grape___Leaf_Blight.Symptoms: Brown spots on leaves with yellow halo; may cause defoliation.
Grape___Leaf_Blight.Prevention: Resistant varieties, remove infected leaves, maintain airflow.

Peach___Bacterial_Spot.Cause: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni.
Peach___Bacterial_Spot.Symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits; leaves may drop and fruits may crack.
Peach___Bacterial_Spot.Prevention: Use disease-free nursery stock, prune properly, avoid overhead watering.
Peach___Bacterial_Spot.Treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides; remove severely infected plant parts.

Peach___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves, stems, and fruits; uniform color with no lesions.
Peach___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper irrigation, nutrition, and pruning.

Potato___Early_Blight.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani.
Potato___Early_Blight.Symptoms: Dark concentric spots on older leaves; leaf yellowing and drop.
Potato___Early_Blight.Prevention: Crop rotation, resistant varieties, remove infected debris.

Potato___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves, stems, and tubers; no lesions or discoloration.
Potato___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper irrigation, nutrition, and pest management.

Potato___Late_Blight.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Phytophthora infestans.
Potato___Late_Blight.Symptoms: Dark lesions on leaves and stems; tuber rot may occur.
Potato___Late_Blight.Prevention: Resistant varieties, crop rotation, avoid overhead watering.
Potato___Late_Blight.Treatment: Fungicides; remove and destroy infected plants.

Strawberry___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves and fruits; no spots or discoloration.
Strawberry___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper irrigation, nutrition, and pruning.

Strawberry___Leaf_Scorch.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Diplocarpon earliana.
Strawberry___Leaf_Scorch.Symptoms: Small purple or brown lesions on leaves; may cause early leaf drop.
Strawberry___Leaf_Scorch.Prevention: Use disease-free plants, maintain proper spacing and irrigation.
Strawberry___Leaf_Scorch.Treatment: Fungicide application; remove and destroy infected leaves.

Tomato___Bacterial_Spot.Cause: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas spp.
Tomato___Bacterial_Spot.Symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves, stems, and fruits; leaves may yellow and drop.
Tomato___Bacterial_Spot.Prevention: Use disease-free seeds, rotate crops, avoid overhead irrigation.
Tomato___Bacterial_Spot.Treatment: Copper-based bactericides; remove infected plant parts.

Tomato___Early_Blight.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani.
Tomato___Early_Blight.Symptoms: Dark, concentric lesions on older leaves; leaves may yellow and drop.
Tomato___Early_Blight.Prevention: Crop rotation, resistant varieties, remove infected debris.

Tomato___Healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves, stems, and fruits; no spots, discoloration, or deformity.
Tomato___Healthy.Prevention: Maintain proper irrigation, nutrition, and pruning.

Tomato___Late_Blight.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Phytophthora infestans.
Tomato___Late_Blight.Symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits; fruit rot may occur.
Tomato___Late_Blight.Prevention: Plant resistant varieties, rotate crops, avoid overhead watering.
Tomato___Late_Blight.Treatment: Fungicide application; remove and destroy infected plants.

Tomato___Septoria_Leaf_Spot.Cause: Fungal infection caused by Septoria lycopersici.
Tomato___Septoria_Leaf_Spot.Symptoms: Small circular spots with dark margins on leaves; leaves may yellow and drop.
Tomato___Septoria_Leaf_Spot.Prevention: Crop rotation, remove infected debris, plant disease-free seeds.

Tomato___Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.Symptoms: Yellowing and curling of leaves; stunted growth and reduced yield.
Tomato___Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.Treatment: No chemical cure; remove infected plants.
